articles.description: News Corp suffered a "persistent cyberattack" in January, the company said Friday, and investigators believe Chinese spies may be responsible.
articles.content:
New York (CNN Business)News Corp suffered a "persistent cyberattack," the company said Friday, and investigators believe Chinese spies may be responsible.

articles.author: Mitchell Clark
articles.title: The cost of ripping and replacing Chinese cellular equipment has ballooned by billions - The Verge
articles.description: The FCC has said that carriers applied for over $5.6 in reimbursement to replace network equipment from Chinese manufacturers ZTE and Huawei. The regulator originally estimated that it’d pay out $1.6 billion.
articles.content:
In 2020 the estimate was $1.8 billion now its $5.6 billion
The original estimate was $1.8 billion. The FCC received applications for $5.6 billion in reimbursements.
